titleStmt.title: Alf. C. Tanner et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4259

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Calhoun 2d Oct. 1863
To Gov. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The Undersigned petitioners would Respectfully Represent that at the Last September Term of the McLean Circuit Court. a fine wof. Fifty Dollars. Was. adjudged against L B Lillard for, Keeping a Tipling House We Want. Represent that. if a Tipling House Was Kept it was under such circumstance that. We think Executive clemency Should be used. and Respectfully ask that. the fine be Remitted

Yours Truly &c
Alf C Tanner
L. G. Alexander
Ren. H. Franklin
W C Mosley
Thomas C Tihoenir
Isaac N Vertrees
D. H. Jones
W Calhoun
R. Dicken
James Hill
D Little P.J.M.C.
R W Allen Provost Marshall McLean Co Ky
Lot. Cooper
John Van Horn
Wm J Mouley
Henry Griffith
Samuel H Jones
Thornley Atchison
C. L. Stuteville
P. H. Preston
Isaac Calhoun
L. L. Little
T M Conelift
A G Wattkins
C G Clark
Ben Croutcher
G L McLaughlin
Nones Foster
W. T. Owen
Elijah H Mosely
George G. Jones
T. H. Jones
James Garrison
J S Garrison
R. D. Heal
W B Riggs
Gor G Verit
W W Mitchel
J. W. Shotredge
Howard Pinkston
Colemon mitcake
Low X Edwards
J. T. Jones

W C Tanner
